This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Discharge Report forwarded to the Judge for review and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($10,000) LW
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued a bench warrant.  Court forfeifted $10,000.00 cash bail.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10
Defendant Ladarius D Davis-Hughes in court, appear by video with attorney Michael T. Judge, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Judge fail to appear to court on time. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM021276  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/18/2022

Defendant Ladarius D Davis-Hughes in court in person prior to the case being called.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Jude is unavailable. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with M.M. or her children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ladarius D Davis-Hughes in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Ladarius D Davis-Hughes in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ladarius D Davis-Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
